results.title: Northern region
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “African Continent”.
The interaction of the modern with the colourful and traditional characterises Northern Africa. This geographic region is greatly influenced by three factors: its primarily Arab background and culture, its age-old lack of water, and its long history of European influence. Shows oasis farming, craftsmanship, and modern industries and cities; and views some of the problems that face Moslems and Europeans.

results.title: Northern New England, USA: an invitation
results.brief_description: Northern New England is a place where, each year nature becomes the artist. This does not only apply to autumn, when nature splashes the mountains with every colour of the rainbow, but to the rest of the seasons as well, making Northern New England an all year round vacation paradise.

results.title: Northern Ireland chronicle
results.brief_description: This is a film about the “troubles” and the associated problems of Northern Ireland. Violence has become a pervasive and tragic factor of life. It is a fact which must be faced and understood. No credits available.

results.title: Northern Ireland
results.brief_description: A summary of the agriculture and industries of Northern Ireland. Following an introductory map, we see farm scenes and typical farming activities; hay making and harvesting oats and potatoes, harvesting and treatment of flax, digging peat for fuel; dairying and fishing. The film ends with the industries of Belfast, linen mills and ship building, and the export from Belfast of the products of Northern Ireland.

results.title: Northern games
results.brief_description: In the northern summer, Inuit (Eskimos) gather together from all over the Arctic Circle. They meet 800 km north of the Arctic Circle to participate in the Northern Games, the traditional games passed on through generations of Inuit. Most of the events are based on the skills and physical endurance so necessary for survival in the Canadian Arctic. Not only do they come to compete in such contests as canoe racing, harpoon throwing and the good woman competition but also to meet friends and relations, to sing, feast and dance the age old drum dances. (Awards: San Antonio; Budapest; Rovaniemi)

results.title: Northern fisherman
results.creator_credit: George Pearson, ONF | NFB and Martin Defalco
results.brief_description: A film about the life of an Indian fisherman of the prairie provinces. For commercial fishermen the film shows simple but effective sanitary measures to protect the freshness and attractiveness of freshwater catches. For general audiences, there is a view of Indian life and enterprise. The commentary is spoken by the fisherman as he goes about his work. He recalls his boyhood when the men of his band freighted by canoe for the Hudson’s Bay Company. But he talks about much more than fishing and hunting. He speaks of education, of sickness and health, of family, of poverty, of the pleasures of a Saturday night dance, and he demonstrates the tricks of his own trade - when to set a net, how to handle fish, and what it all costs in money, time, equipment and skill.

results.title: Northern composition = Airs du nord
results.creator_credit: Bruce Mackay, ONF | NFB and Gary Toole
results.brief_description: Image and music work together—either by contrast or analogy—to conjure up the look of Canada. Moods and activities; far-ranging landscapes; a bird’s-eye view of great industrial complexes: all this and much more are fitted into a compelling visual composition that suggests, rather than spells out, the many ingredients that have slowly built a nation. A film without words.

results.title: Northanger Abbey
results.creator_credit: Louis Marks, BBC and Giles Foster
results.brief_description: This is Jane Austen’s classic story of Catherine Marland, a young girl whose head is stuffed full of romantic and melodramatic notions about the world. Through her adventures, she comes to learn that marriage in the society of her day is determined less by true love and more by mundane matters such as wealth and social status. The high point of the story comes when Catherine visits Northanger Abbey, the ancestral Gothic home of Henry Tilney - the young man she hopes to marry and believes loves her - and finds terrifying evidence that points to a dark secret involving the Tilney family. Rated: G

results.title: North west link
results.brief_description: Made by Telecom and the Postmaster-Generals dept. the film shows the work of laying a 600-mile coaxial cable from Perth to Carnarvon, W.A. The pipe is a link in the national broad-band telecommunication network extending the range of subscriber trunk dialling and television relay facilities.

results.title: North West Cape
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Sentinel”.
The joint U.S.-Australian naval communications station Harold E. Holt has long been controversial for its strategic role in the nuclear arms race and the tight security concerning its operations on Australian soil. This film, produced for the Australian Defence department, documents the military’s view on the naval station and the supposed rationale for its purpose and operation in Western Australia.
